CatDescriptText: Ruth Lee, housewife, Schenley Heights, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "In one way, I would say that it's wrong to talk with him, because of the attitude that he's taking. But if I did talk with him, I would say that it's time to get down to solid business and stop trying to be boss of the world when he shouldn't be boss."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruth Lee wearing light colored coat with three buttons and dark Persian lamb lapels, light colored hat, and eyeglasses, standing in front of clapboard building
